section.p: The following keys must be defined in a configuration file for enabling access to an IdP (Identity Provider):

row.entry:
Mandatory if you want to make use of single logout.
The URL of the endpoint of the IdP system's single logout service. Logout and invalidate session requests from the platform are sent to this address.
Required for Web browser SSO.
For security and confidentiality reasons, it is recommended to use the HTTPS protocol.
Syntax: https://<host>:<port>/<LogoutServiceEndpoint>
If you change this setting, you need to restart the platform.In the IdP system, a URL must be specified to which the response to the logout request is sent and the user is redirected by the logout. We recommend you use the following default marketplace address of the platform: https://<host>:<port>/oscm-portal/marketplace/index.jsf. In case of problems, the user can be automatically redirected from this page to another one specified in the MP_ERROR_REDIRECT_HTTPS configuration setting. Note, however, that this URL is used platform-wide. It is not tenant-specific.

Mandatory if you want to make use of single logout, and the IdP system's single logout service requires signed requests, as, for example, in Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services.
The alias of the private key of the platform to be used for signing logout requests. The IdP system needs the corresponding certificate of the platform in its truststore for verifying the signature.
Required for Web browser SSO.
Example: s1as
If you change this setting, you need to restart the platform.

Mandatory if you install the platform in SAML_SP authentication mode. The SAML Redirect URL for the IdP service endpoint.
Required for Web browser SSO.
For security and confidentiality reasons, it is recommended to use the HTTPS protocol.
Syntax: https://<host>:<port>/<RedirectServiceEndpoint>
If you change this setting, you need to restart the platform.

The method used for HTTP authentication requests. Depending on the IdP, GET or POST requests can be used.
Required for Web browser SSO.
Default: POST
If you change this setting, you need to restart the platform.

A unique identifier for the platform. The IdP uses this ID for identifying incoming SAML authentication requests from the platform.
Required for Web browser SSO.
If you need to change this setting after the first exchange of data between the platform and the IdP, you must change it both in the platform and the IdP system. It may be required to send a new metadata exchange file to the IdP operator. Default: CT_MG
If you change this setting, you need to restart the platform.

Mandatory if you install the platform in SAML_SP authentication mode. The length of the encryption key as used by the IdP.
Required for STS communication.
Default: 128
This setting is an installation property and cannot be changed in the administration portal. If you need to change the encryption key length, proceed as follows:
Stop the bes-domain domain.
Edit the configsettings.properties file and change the value for SSO_STS_ENCKEY_LEN as required.
Execute the build-glassfish.xml file in <install_pack_dir>/install as follows:
<ANT_HOME>/bin/ant -DpatchProps.path=../domains/bes_domain/installer -f build-glassfish.xml patchAndRedeployApplication <ANT_HOME> is the installation directory of Apache Ant.
It may be required to enclose the -DpatchProps.path=<path> command in double or single quotes depending on the operating system. The modified configuration parameter value is read from the configsettings.properties file and written to the WSIT files contained in the oscm.ear archive. The updated archive is redeployed to the bes-domain domain.
During the execution of the above command, a tmp subdirectory is created in <install_pack_dir>/domains/bes_domain to which the updated oscm.ear archive is saved.
Redeploy the oscm-portal.war file to the bes-domain domain.
Restart the bes-domain domain.
